title: Making Basic Improvised Compass
brief: Create a simple compass using magnetized metal and string or water float.
steps: Step 1: Find a piece of ferrous metal that can be needle-shaped or a flat razor blade.
Step 2: Magnetize the metal by slowly stroking it in one direction on silk or through hair using deliberate strokes.
Step 3: Always stroke in the same direction only - never back and forth.
Step 4: Suspend the magnetized metal from nonmetallic string or long hair, OR
Step 5: Float it on a small piece of wood in still water.
Step 6: The metal will align itself with the north-south line.
warnings: Metal must be ferrous (iron-containing) to be magnetized.
Water must be still for floating method to work.
String or hair must be nonmetallic to avoid interference.
